snippet: A website for the city’s public schools will allow parents to view information on their children like attendance and report card grades.
abstract: New York City Education Department unveils website NYC Schools, which will allow parents to view their children’s attendance, grades and standardized test scores; website replaces former Mayor Michael Bloomberg's ARIS data system, which was far more expensive and hardly used by parents.
lead_paragraph: A website for the city’s public schools will allow parents to view information on their children like attendance and report card grades.

headline.main: New York City Creates Replacement for Student Data Website
headline.print_headline: City Creates Replacement for Student Data Website
